email.title: Weekly Digest

image.title: Nature Valley granola bars are great until they start crumbling apart.

email.text: Last week was yet again another busy week with Facebook's talk on Search and Machine Learning, NextJump's workshop on React Native and a wholesome Board Games night. In the coming week, we're bringing you even more events, including a Game AI workshop, escape room, sponsor event and more. Keep on reading for more info!
email.heading: Sponsors' Portal
email.text:
Searching for internships or placements? Check out our Sponsors Portal, where you can find out more details about our sponsors, read their blog posts and see their open internship/placement positions. You can also upload your CV and directly apply to all of our Gold and Silver tier sponsors!
You can access the portal at: https://portal.docsoc.co.uk
email.heading: CGCU Mascotry
email.text:
Last Wednesday, seven members of the City and Guilds Union (CGCU), including five from DoCSoc, undertook the incredible feat of stealing the Davy Lamp from the Royal School of Mines Union (RSMU). Tensions were high as Memeperial [misleadingly reported](https://www.facebook.com/memeperial/photos/a.1243171632387880/1982226031815766) that it was CGCU which instead succumbed to the hands of the Royal College of Science Union (RSCU) at mascotry. However, with an unexpected twist, the true identities of the mascot's kidnappers [were revealed](https://www.facebook.com/memeperial/photos/a.1243171632387880/1982393761798993).
On Thursday the CGCU struck again, raiding the RCSU office to capture their mascot Theta. This time out of the 13 rescuers, a whopping 10 were members of DoCSoc! Great job, and looking forward to the Medics' mascot being stolen!
email.heading: Introduction to AI in Games

event.text:
Curious about Artificial Intelligence and its practical applications in games?
Join DoCSoc GameDev as we learn about Artificial Intelligence in modern games with a short talk followed by a workshop on the application of the Monte Carlo Tree Search Algorithm through coding a Connect 4 game in Python.
The workshop will be run by Daniel Hernandez and Peter York who are both on course for PhDs in AI applied to videogames at the University of York.
The only thing you will need is a laptop with Python 3 installed and the workshop is open to programmers of all skill levels.
Food will of course be provided, with informal drinks following the session at the Union afterwards! If you have any specific dietary requirements, please let us know a few days beforehand.

email.heading: DoCSoc Gets Locked In A Room

event.location: Locked In A Room, 1 Western Gateway, Royal Victoria Docks, ExCeL London, E161X
event.text:
It is finally time for the first social event of the year! Congratulations to all of you who managed to get tickets for Locked In A Room. Join DoCSoc in an evening full of solving puzzles, discovering clues and trying your best to escape a locked room in 60 minutes. You will get the option to form your own teams of 5 and if you don’t have a team, you can always find one once you reach there.
Be sure to arrive by 3:30pm so we can begin promptly.
There's exciting news **for those of you who didn’t manage to get a ticket**: there will another session on the 14th of November! Make sure to keep an eye out for the tickets for this session, which will go live on Tuesday 6th November at 1PM.
Have fun escaping!

email.heading: Bloomberg CodeCon Qualifiers

event.text:
Face off against your classmates at CodeCon, a live coding competition hosted by Bloomberg.
Push your programming and problem solving skills to the limit against the clock!
The top finishers from each university will be invited to Bloomberg's London headquarters for a showdown against finalists from schools across the globe and a chance to win amazing prizes!
Food and drinks will be provided! If you have any specific dietary requirements, please let us know a few days beforehand.
Be sure to **RSVP and register** for CodeCon [here](http://tinyurl.com/yb6ugj36).

email.heading: Liquidnet In-Office Interactive Session: Trading, AI and Augmenting Behavior

event.location: Liquidnet Offices, 21st Floor, Broadgate Tower, Primrose St, London, EC2A 2EW
event.text:
JOIN LIQUIDNET CHIEF DATA SCIENTIST TOM DORIS, PHD. to discuss challenges in adoption and adherence of new technologies by human experts, deconstruct the methods that were effective in overcoming the obstacles, and review similarities across other industries.
There will be an opportunity to network with members of Tom's Technology team, our Recruitment Team and Product Team once the interactive session has ended.
Refreshments will be served.

email.heading: LSEG WIN Breakfast Sessions for Young Female Talents

event.location: LSEG City of London Global Headquarters, 10 Paternoster Square, London, EC4M 7LS
event.text:
**Limited spaces available!**
The **LSEG WIN (Women Inspired Network)** Community aims to provide a platform to celebrate female talents within and outside the Group. As part of the WIN Campus Taskforce, we’d like to invite a small group of elite female students from four top London universities (LSE, UCL, KCL, and Imperial College London) to attend our breakfast sessions to understand and explore the financial industry with the help of industry leaders and senior executives.
We are excited to offer this opportunity to young talented female students to help them to gain more exposure to financial markets, whilst networking with like-minded peers.
The three breakfast sessions will cover the below topics respectively:
- **Fintech and LSEG Initiatives** - Thursday, 22 November, 9:00am - 10:00am - **Alternative Career Options in Finance** - Wednesday, 5 December, 9:00am – 10:00am
For more information on what each session is about, take a look at the PDF attached.
Location: LSEG City of London Global Headquarters, 10 Paternoster Square, London EC4M 7LS
These breakfasts are _mutually exclusive_ and we are taking five students from Imperial per session.
If you're interested, email DoCSoc at docsoc@imperial.ac.uk and they'll pass your details onto us!

email.heading: Google DevFest London 2018

event.text:
DoCSoc is proud to be hosting Google DevFest London on our very own campus this year! Read on for more information.
**Learn the latest in web, mobile, cloud, machine learning and more at the UK's largest community organised free conference.**
GDG London, Google and DoCSoc present GDG Devfest London - a multi-track event covering: cloud and machine learning; web; mobile; assistant; codelabs and demos.
To find out more about speakers, topics and agenda, visit devfest.gdg.london
Don’t miss out on a fun, interesting and informative day of expert speakers, demo stands coding labs and much much more.
You’ll also get the chance to network with experts from Google, Imperial College and beyond and learn more from some of the amazing developer communities we have in London.
There will be people taking photographs and potentially filming the event. By attending you agree to the possibility of being photographed and filmed once inside the venue.
Thank you for your interest in GDG DevFest London and we look forward to seeing you there!

email.sponsor:
We have a number of new 2019 Security Engineering Summer internship opportunities open for applications. Please see further details below:
- Our programme will start on 24th June and last for 12 weeks - We are open to Bachelors, Masters and PhD students who are in their penultimate year of study/graduating in 2020 - We are specifically interested in students that are studying Computer Science, Cyber Security, Information Security, Information Forensics or other related degrees. We are also particularly interested in students that partake in Cyber Security activities and events such as CTF (Capure the Flag), bug bounty participation or something similar
Please find more info and application links below:
- 2019 Security Engineer, Intern (Product) - London - https://www.facebook.com/careers/jobs/285333835643814/ - 2019 Security Engineer, Intern (CERT & Detection Infra) - London - https://www.facebook.com/careers/jobs/710700472618593/ - 2019 Security Analyst, Intern (Dublin) - https://www.facebook.com/careers/jobs/553516991773728/
